body: Hi Taizo, What coordinate system is your measured data in? The default data format( if I am not mistaken) for the BSDF data in Radiance is the LBNL Full Klems format i.e there are 145 x 145 values for incident and exitant radiation. A while ago, I had written a python script for reading BSDF XML-files (see attached). The SingleClear.xml that you posted above will read something like : [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/hAXKVxAmtpKdfQZEp6PzQ0zIhZaq0Zbs55zDuvzuelGiZhLVI3CpmlKgtB-LaWR-N61XeBiOcHxeDLC7LCTZvigzH-VPdisR/Selection_029.png) Do the values that you have for your film match the 145 x 145 format corresponding to the LBNL Klem's full basis format?  Here are a couple of other links related to measuring and incorporating BSDF in Radiance: [PAB](https://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2011-berkeley-ca/presentations/day1/PAB1_FittingPlasticMetal.pdf) and [Jonsson,McNeil](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0038092X13003940)
